Platform.Title: [HuGene-1_0-st] Affymetrix Human Gene 1.0 ST Array [transcript (gene) version]
Platform.Description:
Affymetrix submissions are typically submitted to GEO using the GEOarchive method described at http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/projects/geo/info/geo_affy.html
June 03, 2009: annotation table updated with netaffx build 28 June 18, 2012: annotation table updated with netaffx build 32 July 01, 2016: annotation table updated with netaffx build 35

Column.Name: GB_LIST
Column.Description: GenBank and RefSeq Accessions from mrna_assignment column

Column.Name: SPOT_ID
Column.Description: genomic location of the transcript cluster in the version of the genome assembly used at annotation time. Coordinates are standard 1-based (length=stop-start+1).

Column.Name: RANGE_GB
Column.Description: NCBI RefSeq for chromosome of current build

Column.Name: total_probes
Column.Description: Total number of probes contained by this transcript cluster.

Column.Name: gene_assignment
Column.Description: Gene information for each assigned mRNA for mRNAs that corresponds to known genes (multipart).

Column.Name: mrna_assignment
Column.Description: Description of the public mRNAs that should be detected by the sets within this transcript cluster based on sequence alignment (multipart).

Column.Name: category
Column.Description: Array design category of the transcript cluster

Sample.Title: 301.sepsis_alone

Channel.Treatment-Protocol: RNA stabilized at room temperature as per protocol
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Whole blood was stored in coded and de-identified PAXgeneTM tubes (PreAnalytiX, Hombrechtikon, CH) tubes at -80° Celsius.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: RNA was extracted using the PAXgeneTM miRNA kit (Qiagen, Valencia, CA) and processed in two separate batches balanced for cases and sepsis alones using identical materials and methods. Quality, quantity and purity of the RNA was assessed by electrophoresis (Bioanalyzer, Agilent, Inc) and spectrophotometry.
Channel.Label: biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: The NuGEN Ovation® Whole Blood Reagent (NuGEN technology, San Carlos, CA) was used for amplification, fragmentation and biotin-labeling, which enables gene expression of whole blood RNA without the need for additional globin reduction.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was hybridized to the Affymetrix Human GeneChip® Gene 1.0 ST array (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA), integrating 28,869 genes with 764,885 probes (~26 probes per gene).
Sample.Data-Processing: CEL files were generated using AGCC 4.0.0.1567G. The values in the CEL files were then normalized with the RMA normalization method, using the Affymetrix Power Tools suite, version 1.12.0.

Sample.Data-Processing: CEL files were generated using AGCC 4.0.0.1567G. The values in the CEL files were then normalized with the RMA normalization method, using the Affymetrix Power Tools suite, version 1.12.0.

Channel.Label-Protocol: The NuGEN Ovation® Whole Blood Reagent (NuGEN technology, San Carlos, CA) was used for amplification, fragmentation and biotin-labeling, which enables gene expression of whole blood RNA without the need for additional globin reduction.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Labeled cDNA was hybridized to the Affymetrix Human GeneChip® Gene 1.0 ST array (Affymetrix, Santa Clara, CA), integrating 28,869 genes with 764,885 probes (~26 probes per gene).
Sample.Data-Processing: CEL files were generated using AGCC 4.0.0.1567G. The values in the CEL files were then normalized with the RMA normalization method, using the Affymetrix Power Tools suite, version 1.12.0.

Series.Title: Expression of Neutrophil-related genes in patients with early sepsis-induced ARDS
Series.Summary: Clinical study of critically ill patients with sepsis and sepsis-related ARDS with whole blood RNA collected within the first 24 hours of admission Goal of the study was to determine whether biologically relevant genes were identified to be differentially expressed genes in patients with sepsis alone and sepsis with ARDS
Series.Overall-Design: Prospective observational study, case cohort design
